True Colors of U.S. "Anti-Terrorist War" Disclosed
articles.content:
True Colors of U.S. "Anti-Terrorist War" Disclosed 
    Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The "anti-terrorist war" by the U.S. imperialists is one of the basic means to stifle anti-imperialist independent countries and achieve their ambition for world domination, says Rodong Sinmun today in a signed article.
 The article goes on:    
 The U.S. imperialists are now pursuing an appeasement policy toward big countries so as not to aggravate relations with them, but pressurizing and threatening anti-imperialist independent countries with a hard-line policy to overturn them one by one. Here they are attaching foremost importance to the "anti-terrorist war."
 The "anti-terrorist war" of the U.S. imperialists is the most heinous and mean state terrorism, a war of pillage.    
 Staging the "anti-terrorist war", the U.S. considers smear propaganda as one of the basic tricks to find a pretext of aggression. To conduct a smear campaign against anti-imperialist independent countries and stir up the world public for it is a prior process of the U.S. "anti-terrorist war" and a prelude to an armed invasion.
 Along with false propaganda, forcible inspection of sovereign states is a major factor of the U.S. "anti-terrorist war". It is one process of the U.S. "anti-terrorist war" to "prove" its false data through inspection and put international pressure. 
 It is another trick of the U.S. "anti-terrorist war" to rig up pretexts and conditions for the deployment of the armed forces of aggression and the beginning of military action.
 Psychological warfare is one of major U.S. tricks in the "anti-terrorist war". The U.S. psychological warfare is a heinous trick for the "anti-terrorist war" which paves the way for invasion with words and money instead of arms.    
 What is noticeable in the U.S. "anti-terrorist war" is to start a war of aggression against one target while conducting a smear campaign against the next target of aggression. Those countries designated by the Bush administration as an "axis of evil" and "dangerous states" are the objects of the "anti-terrorist war".
 In order to frustrate the U.S. "anti-terrorist war" it is imperative to have a resolute anti-U.S. and anti-war stand and strengthen national defence power. To strengthen national defence power is the foremost way to foil the U.S. "anti-terrorist war" and defend the sovereignty, security and peace of a country.

Greetings to President of Senegal
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Senegal 
    Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greetings to Abdoulaye Wade, president of Senegal, on the occasion the 46th anniversary of its independence. 
 Noting that he is glad to see the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries favorably developing in the mutual interests, Kim in the message sincerely wished the Senegalese president great success in his responsible work for the development and the national unity of the country.

New Fuel-Saving Additive Developed
articles.content:
New Fuel-Saving Additive Developed
    Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The Onchon County Farm Machine Station in South Phyongan Province of the DPRK has developed a new kind of fuel-saving additive.
 When the additive is mixed with gasoline or diesel, it increases combustion efficiency of rolling stocks and engines, thus economizing 30-35 percent of fuel and extending serviceable life of engines by more than 30 percent as against before using the additive.
 200 grams are enough for one ton of fuel.    
 Its production method is very simple. It, therefore, can be made right before using. 
 As its density remains unchanged, it can be kept for a long time. 
 It is made with raw materials rich in the country and chemicals which are common to be used in local industrial factories.
